title: Biomechanical Analysis Technique Workshop for Early Keratoconus Diagnosis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of ophthalmology and experience in medical imaging analysis
context.additional_context: Learners aim for medical translation or related vocational training in the language domain, strengthening biomechanical data interpretation skills

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least four biomechanical indicators at the pixel level in dynamic corneal deformation imaging.
Learners can simulate a process achieving over 90% accuracy in early keratoconus diagnosis using a machine learning-based ensemble model.
A report can be generated to quantitatively compare the performance differences between existing clinical diagnostic indicators and new biomechanical methods.

resources: Scheimpflug Imaging Analysis Software Demo Version

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
